intro: Antiphylla aretioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in the wild.
